org.apache.flex.compiler.mxml

Interface IMXMLUnitData

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ISourceLocation
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IMXMLInstructionData, IMXMLTagData, IMXMLTextData
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MXMLInstructionData, MXMLTagData, MXMLTextData, MXMLUnitData

    public interface IMXMLUnitData
extends ISourceLocation
    Represents one unit of MXML.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.apache.flex.compiler.common.ISourceLocation

        UNKNOWN

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsOffset(int offset)
      Does this unit contain the given offset (excluding start and including end)?
      IMXMLTagData getContainingTag(int offset)
      Get the nearest containing tag.
      int getContentEnd()
      Returns the offset after the last character of actual content.
      int getContentStart()
      Returns the first character of the actual content of the unit For most units this is the same as getStart(), but for things like tags which have "junk punctuation" around them, SourceLocation.getAbsoluteStart() will return the junk punctuation, whereas getContentStart will get the content inside the punctuation.
      int getIndex()
      Get this unit's position in the IMXMLData.
      MXMLDialect getMXMLDialect()
      Returns the MXML dialect used in the MXML document that contains this unit.
      IMXMLUnitData getNext()
      Gets the next MXML unit.
      IMXMLUnitData getNextSiblingUnit()
      Gets the next sibling unit after this unit.
      IMXMLTagData getNextTag()
      Gets the next tag.
      IMXMLData getParent()
      Gets the IMXMLData representing the MXML document that contains this unit.
      IMXMLUnitData getParentUnitData()
      Gets the IMXMLUnitData which is the hierarchical parent of this unit in its parents array of IMXMLUnitData objects
      IMXMLUnitData getPrevious()
      Gets the previous MXML unit.
      IFileSpecification getSource()
      Gets the source file that contains this unit.
      boolean isCloseTag()
      Is this MXML unit an close tag?
      boolean isOpenAndNotEmptyTag()
      Is this MXML unit an open tag and not an empty tag (i.e. only <foo>, not <foo;/>)?
      boolean isOpenTag()
      Is this MXML unit an open tag?
      boolean isTag()
      Is this MXML unit a tag?
      boolean isText()
      Is this MXML unit a block of text?

      • Methods inherited from interface org.apache.flex.compiler.common.ISourceLocation

        getAbsoluteEnd, getAbsoluteStart, getColumn, getEnd, getEndColumn, getEndLine, getLine, getSourcePath, getStart

    • Method Detail

      • getSource

        IFileSpecification getSource()
        Gets the source file that contains this unit.
        Returns:
        An IFileSpecification representing the source file.

      • getParent

        IMXMLData getParent()
        Gets the IMXMLData representing the MXML document that contains this unit.
        Returns:
        The IMXMLData that contains this unit.

      • getMXMLDialect

        MXMLDialect getMXMLDialect()
        Returns the MXML dialect used in the MXML document that contains this unit.
        Returns:
        An MXMLDialect object.

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        Get this unit's position in the IMXMLData.
        Returns:
        The index of this unit.

      • containsOffset

        boolean containsOffset(int offset)
        Does this unit contain the given offset (excluding start and including end)?
        Returns:
        true if the offset falls within this unit's bounds.

      • getParentUnitData

        IMXMLUnitData getParentUnitData()
        Gets the IMXMLUnitData which is the hierarchical parent of this unit in its parents array of IMXMLUnitData objects
        Returns:
        the parent IMXMLUnitData or null.

      • getContainingTag

        IMXMLTagData getContainingTag(int offset)
        Get the nearest containing tag. Moving backwards through the list of tokens for this MXML file, this is the first open tag that you find for which you haven't found a corresponding close.
        Returns:
        nearest containing open tag (or null, if no such open tag exists)

      • isText

        boolean isText()
        Is this MXML unit a block of text?
        Returns:
        true if the unit is a block of text

      • isTag

        boolean isTag()
        Is this MXML unit a tag?
        Returns:
        true if the unit is a tag

      • isOpenTag

        boolean isOpenTag()
        Is this MXML unit an open tag?
        Returns:
        true if the unit is an open tag

      • isOpenAndNotEmptyTag

        boolean isOpenAndNotEmptyTag()
        Is this MXML unit an open tag and not an empty tag (i.e. only <foo>, not <foo;/>)?
        Returns:
        true if the unit is an open tag, and not an empty tag

      • isCloseTag

        boolean isCloseTag()
        Is this MXML unit an close tag?
        Returns:
        true if the unit is a close tag

      • getContentStart

        int getContentStart()
        Returns the first character of the actual content of the unit For most units this is the same as getStart(), but for things like tags which have "junk punctuation" around them, SourceLocation.getAbsoluteStart() will return the junk punctuation, whereas getContentStart will get the content inside the punctuation.

      • getContentEnd

        int getContentEnd()
        Returns the offset after the last character of actual content. See getContentStart() for more.

      • getNext

        IMXMLUnitData getNext()
        Gets the next MXML unit.
        Returns:
        The next MXML unit.

      • getNextSiblingUnit

        IMXMLUnitData getNextSiblingUnit()
        Gets the next sibling unit after this unit. The next sibling unit may be a tag or text. If there is no sibling unit after this one, this method returns null.
        Returns:
        The next sibling unit.

      • getNextTag

        IMXMLTagData getNextTag()
        Gets the next tag.
        Returns:
        The next tag, or null if none.

      • getPrevious

        IMXMLUnitData getPrevious()
        Gets the previous MXML unit.
        Returns:
        the previous MXML unit.
